headline: Lululemon reports Q4 beat, CoreWeave IPO priced at $40: Morning Buzz
summary: The major indexes were sharply lower near noon as investors react to the release of key inflation data and recent trade policy developments. The Federal Reserve’s key inflation measure, the core personal consumption expenditures price index, showed a 0.4% increase for the month of February, putting the 12-month inflation rate at a hotter-than-expected 2.8%. Looking to commodities, gold prices are fractionally higher, continuing their rally and bringing the record price to above $3,100. Meanwhile

headline: Lululemon price target lowered to $309 from $411 at Barclays
summary: Barclays analyst Adrienne Yih lowered the firm’s price target on Lululemon (LULU) to $309 from $411 and keeps an Equal Weight rating on the shares. The firm notes Lululemon’s Q4 results beat expectations on sales, gross margin, SGA, and EPS due to strong performance in China and Men’s. But at the midpoint, guidance for Q1 2025 and FY25 came in about 7% and 2% below consensus, respectively, due to traffic pressure and growing macro uncertainty. headline: Lululemon CEO sounds alarm on unexpected customer behavior
summary: The athletic apparel retailer is suffering from a concerning consumer trend.

raw.headline: Lululemon CEO sounds alarm on unexpected customer behavior

headline: Lululemon price target lowered to $385 from $445 at Telsey Advisory
summary: Telsey Advisory analyst Dana Telsey lowered the firm’s price target on Lululemon (LULU) to $385 from $445 and keeps an Outperform rating on the shares. The company’s Q4 results “nicely topped” consensus, with sales and growth margins coming in stronger than the company’s updated outlook given in January, the analyst tells investors. The newness was back to historical levels in Q1 of 2025, but the company saw slow traffic in February in the US given macro concerns and waning consumer confidence,

headline: Yoga Pants Blues
summary: As the current corporate earnings season winds down, the last companies to report are giving us a preview of what to expect when the Q1 numbers start coming out next month.

raw.headline: Yoga Pants Blues
